com.epoch.db
Class QuestionStoreWriter

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.db.DBTables
      com.epoch.db.QuestionStoreWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
StaticLimits, QuestionConstants, XMLConstants
public final class QuestionStoreWriter
extends DBTables
implements QuestionConstants

Contains all database write operations pertaining to questions. All methods are static. (Too large to instantiate.) (SYNC problems?)

Notes about figures: Serial numbers are set by the order in which figures appear in a Q. The order of existing figures can't be changed, but if a figure is deleted, when the Q is stored, the other figures' serial numbers are resequenced. The figureId is set to negative if a figure has been modified.

setQuestion

private static Question setQuestion(Connection con,
                                    int qId,
                                    Question question,
                                    String authorId)
                             throws DBException
Set a question with the id in the master table or a user's private table, falling back under failure. The question passed in here still refers to the stored qBuffer in session memory. So directly changing any of its values can in fact affect the original buffered question. So be sure that the returned question is a fresh instance, at every level: Don't put any instance of question in changedQ. Instead, use the the copy constructors in Evaluator and Figure.

Parameters:
con - database connection
qId - unique ID of question to be written
question - question to be written
authorId - login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID of the question author (null if master)
Returns:
question that was written
Throws:
DBException

processSingletonData

private static void processSingletonData(Question question,
                                         Question changedQ,
                                         Connection con,
                                         DBTables tables,
                                         StringBuilder qIdStr,
                                         int setId)
                                  throws SQLException
Adds statement, provenance, flags, serial number, keywords of the question to the table. Deletes translations of the question statement.

Parameters:
question - question to be written
changedQ - question after it has been written
con - database connection
tables - master or local database tables
qIdStr - unique ID of question, plus author's login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID if local
setId - unique ID of question set
Throws:
SQLException

writeEvaluatorRecs

private static void writeEvaluatorRecs(Connection con,
                                       DBTables tables,
                                       StringBuilder qIdStr,
                                       Evaluator eval)
                                throws SQLException,
                                       IOException
Writes out an evaluator record with given majorId. eval.miscMessage contains log of displayable actions. NOTE: Even though subevaluators can have subevaluators which can have subevaluators, every evaluator has only one majorId and one minorId. A simple evaluator has minorId = 0; all subevaluators of a complex evaluator have the same majorId and consecutive minorIds beginning at 1, and the arbitrary depth of the complex evaluator's expression is stored in the String subexpr.

Parameters:
con - database connection
tables - master or local
qIdStr - question ID; if locally authored, also contains the author's login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID
eval - evaluator to be stored
Throws:
SQLException
IOException

setQSerialNos

public static void setQSerialNos(Connection con,
                                 int[] qIds,
                                 String authorId)
                          throws DBException
Sets serial numbers of questions in a set. Called by QSet. Set the numbers negative so that questions added later will be at the end of the list.

Parameters:
con - database connection
qIds - unique ID numbers of questions in order of their serial numbers
authorId - login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID of the question author (null if master)
Throws:
DBException
